summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from October 2021 to January 2022 between the New York County District Attorney's Office (Manhattan DA) and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY). The emails discuss coordination regarding separate investigations into sexual assault allegations against Leon Black. The Manhattan DA is investigating allegations by a specific victim, while the SDNY had previously been involved with another victim's attorney following the Maxwell trial. The SDNY indicates they have no current plans to open another investigation.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: The individual against whom sexual assault allegations are being investigated by both the Manhattan DA's Office and the SDNY.

persons.name: Assistant District Attorney
persons.role: Assistant District Attorney, New York County District Attorney's Office
persons.context: Primary correspondent from the Manhattan DA's Office, reaching out to the SDNY to coordinate on the investigation into Leon Black.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.role: Assistant United States Attorney, Southern District of New York
persons.context: Primary correspondent from the SDNY, responding to the Manhattan DA's inquiries about the status of their investigation involving Leon Black.

persons.name: AUSA
persons.role: Assistant United States Attorney, Southern District of New York
persons.context: An SDNY prosecutor who is familiar with a victim and is noted as the best person to speak with about her.

persons.name: ADA
persons.role: Assistant District Attorney, New York County District Attorney's Office
persons.context: A colleague from the Manhattan DA's Office who had previously spoken with the SDNY about the investigation.

connections.description: Corresponding to coordinate and share information regarding separate investigations into sexual assault allegations against Leon Black.
The SDNY prosecutor is familiar with a victim in an investigation involving Leon Black.
The Manhattan DA prosecutor is investigating sexual abuse allegations made against Leon Black.

events.title: Manhattan DA Reaches Out to SDNY
events.description: The Manhattan District Attorney's Office emails the SDNY to initiate contact regarding their separate investigations into sexual abuse allegations against Leon Black.

events.title: Phone Call Scheduling
events.description: The Manhattan DA and SDNY prosecutors schedule a phone call to discuss the status of the SDNY's investigation involving Leon Black.

events.title: SDNY Declines Further Investigation
events.description: The SDNY informs the Manhattan DA that they have no current plans to interview again or open another investigation into Leon Black, referencing a previous interest in a second victim after the Maxwell trial.

locations: New York County District Attorney's Office
keyFacts: The Manhattan District Attorney's Office was actively investigating sexual assault allegations against financier Leon Black as of late 2021/early 2022.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York had previously conducted an investigation involving Leon Black and a victim whose attorney they met with after the Maxwell trial.
The SDNY informed the Manhattan DA in January 2022 that they had no current plans to open another investigation into Leon Black, even if the Manhattan DA's investigation encompassed both victims.
The email chain shows direct coordination and attempted information sharing between two major prosecutorial offices regarding overlapping investigations into the same individual.
The context references the conclusion of the Ghislaine Maxwell trial as a temporal marker for the SDNY's previous investigative activity.
